page.title: 04Hornby Castle
page.content: The original castle was built near the River Lune to the North of the village. The present castle was built in the early 12th. Century by Adam de Montbegon. Sir Edward Stanley took possession of the castle in the 16th. Century. His victory against the Scots at the Battle of Flodden earned him the title of Lord Monteagle. His grandson warned James I of the "Gunpowder Plot" in 1605 as a result of a letter advising him to stay away. The castle was attacked and seized by Cromwell's Parliamentarian troops during the Civil War. Since the 18th. Century the castle has changed hands several times.Today Hornby Castle is owned by the Battersby family. It is a private residence and is not open to the public though the grounds are occasionally opened on behalf of charity functions.
